questions.text: A man was brought to the emergency after he suddenly became unconscious while working in the field. On examination, his temperature was 105 degrees Fahrenheit and his skin turgor was decreased. Which of the following would not be seen in the patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

The given clinical vignette in a patient with signs of dehydration and a body temperature of 105°F is highly suggestive of heatstroke. Sweating would not be seen in a patient with heatstroke.

choices.text: Both surface tension and compliance decreased
Both surface tension and compliance increased

questions.text: A preterm baby who was delivered at 28 weeks developed respiratory distress syndrome. Which of the following is true about surface tension and compliance in this baby?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

This preterm baby who developed respiratory distress syndrome has surfactant deficiency. In case of surfactant deficiency, the surface tension increases and compliance decreases.

questions.text: A 65-year-old man suffered from a stroke 2 days ago. He now presents with involuntary, violent, and flinging movements of the limbs on one side. What is the likely site of lesion in this patient?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

The above clinical scenario is suggestive of hemiballismus. A lesion in subthalamic nuclei is responsible for this condition.

questions.text: A middle-aged female patient presented with slowly progressive motor weakness, nuchal rigidity, and difficulty in swallowing and carrying out day-to-day activities. A provisional diagnosis of multiple sclerosis is suspected. Which of the following cells are affected in multiple sclerosis?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Oligodendrocytes are affected in multiple sclerosis.

questions.text: A child with loose stools for one day presented to your OPD. On examination, signs of dehydration were present and the child was given ORS. It facilitates glucose absorption through which of the following receptors?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

ORS facilitates glucose absorption through SGLT 1 (Sodium-dependent glucose co-transporter - 1). In a child with diarrhea, when oral rehydration solution is given, there is coupled absorption of sodium and glucose through SGLT -1.

questions.text: A body fluid sample is being studied and has Na: 10 mEq/L, K: 140 mEq/L, CI: 4 mEq/L. Identify the compartment from which the sample has been obtained?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

The sample obtained is from the intracellular fluid (ICF) compartment. The ICF contains large quantities of potassium (K+) ions - 140 mEq/L. The ICF also has lesser amounts of sodium (Na+) and Chloride (Cl-) ions.

choices.text: Volume that remains after forced expiration

questions.text: A 65-year-old man with COPD undergoes a pulmonary function test. The clinician explains that the functional residual capacity measurement is required. Functional residual capacity is:
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Functional Residual Capacity (FRC) is expiratory reserve volume + residual volume.
From the picture given below, (FRC = ERV + RV).

choices.text: Fine touch lost on the opposite side
Pain and temperature lost on the same side
Pain and temperature lost on the opposite side
Only pain lost on the same side

questions.text: A 30-year-old man sustains a stab wound to the right side of his thoracic spine. On examination, he exhibitsfeatures of Brown sequerd syndrome. Which of the following is most likely finding?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Hemisection of the spinal cord causes damage to ascending sensory (dorsal column pathway, ventrolateral spinothalamic tract) and descending motor (corticospinal tract) pathways, which is called the Brown-Séquard syndrome.

questions.text: A patient presented with reports suggesting high levels ACTH and cortisol. Which of the following conditions would be likely?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

Among the given conditions, the levels of ACTH and cortisol will be highest in Cushing's disease. Cushing's disease is caused by an ACTH secreting pituitary adenoma. The increased ACTH causes increased cortisol production.

questions.text: In a type 2 diabetes mellitus patient, serum insulin levels are found to be raised. He is advised to exercise to improve insulin resistance. Which of the following GLUT will help to improve insulin resistance after exercise?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (D)

GLUT 4

There is an increase in the number of GLUT 4 receptors in response to exercise. This increases the insulin dependent glucose uptake into the cells, contributing to a decrease in insulin resistance.

questions.text: A 50-year-old patient presents with a chronic tingling sensation in the forearm. A neurological examination is done and appears to be normal. Which of the following receptors are correctly matched?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Pacinian corpuscles-fast vibration

Pacinian corpuscles are responsible for sensing fast vibration. The chronic tingling sensation is mediated by pressure-sensitive Aß fibers and low-conduction velocity C fibers.

questions.text: What are the effects of posterior lesions in Brodmann’s area 22 in a stroke patient, particularly in relation to language comprehension and production?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Receptive Speech Function

A posterior lesion in Brodmann’s area 22, which is located in the superior temporal gyrus, typically affects receptive speech function. It is the sensory speech area. The patient will most likely have Wernicke’s aphasia due to the damage to Wernicke’s area – area 22.

choices.text: Ttricuspid valve bulging into right atria

questions.text: In the Jugular Venous Pressure waveform what does the “a” wave correspond to?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Atrial contraction

‘A’ wave of the JVP corresponds to atrial contraction.

questions.text: In a patient, after administration of Noradrenaline injection, the heart rate started to decrease. What is the reason behind it?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Stimulation of baroreceptors

The decrease in heart rate (bradycardia) after noradrenaline (norepinephrine) injection is due to the stimulation of baroreceptors (baroreceptor reflex, also known as the baroreflex).

questions.text: A postmenopausal lady with osteoporosis is advised to remain upright for at least half an hour after administration of her medication. What side effect is being prevented by doing this?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

Reflux esophagitis

Bisphosphonates are used in the first-line management of postmenopausal osteoporosis. Remaining upright for 30 minutes after dosing is recommended to prevent reflux esophagitis.

questions.text: A person is performing weightlifting and attempts to lift the dumbbells overhead. Which of the following changes will be seen in the sarcomere during this process?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (B)

I band decreases

During skeletal muscle contraction, sliding of thin filament over thick filament (cross bridge formation) reduces the length of the ‘I’ band.

questions.text: Which one of the following is related to the release of bicarbonate in exchange for chloride in the RBC to maintain electrical neutrality?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Chloride shift
The release of bicarbonate in exchange for chloride in the RBC to maintain electrical neutrality is known as the chloride shift or Hamburger phenomenon.

questions.text: Phases of the ventricular muscle action potential are shown below. At which phase of the below image, the action potential is most dependant on sodium permeability?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Phase 0

The action potential is most dependant on sodium permeability in phase 0.

questions.text: The patient presented with alcoholic gait, and abnormal eye movements (nystagmus) after RTA. Which lobe of the cerebellum is likely affected?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (A)

Flocculonodular Lobe

The flocculonodular lobe is involved in this patient with an alcoholic gait and abnormal eye movements (nystagmus) following an RTA.

questions.text: A boy presented to the emergency with severe rice-watery diarrhea and dehydration. Upon investigating, he was diagnosed to have cholera. On which of the following enzymes in the intestinal tract does the cholera toxin act?
questions.solution:
Correct Answer (C)

Adenylyl cyclase

Cholera toxin acts on the adenylyl cyclase enzyme. The diarrhea is due to the action of this toxin that acts by stimulating the enzyme adenylate cyclase, which catalyzes the production of cyclic AMP from ATP.
